content: color pull the magic_ring closed 16 half_double_crochet round 2 a i used b in this round for clearer photos this round will be invisible after round 4 remember single_crochet in blo remember the 1st st after the chain 1 is made in the next st remember the last st of the round is made in the same st as the chain 1 was made in chain 1 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in the next st x 8 slip_stitch in the bl of the 1st single_crochet and pull through c 3 single_crochet round 3 c skip the st behind each double_crochet there is no increase of stitches in this round the double_crochet in this round are made in every other fl of the stitches of round 1 chain 1 single_crochet double_crochet single_crochet x 8 slip_stitch in the bl of the 1st single_crochet and pull through b 2 single_crochet 1 double_crochet © big splash by yvonne van zijl @bokkyshome 2023 8 round 4 b remember leave unused color behind do not cut no stitches are skipped behind the treble_crochet chain 1 2 single_crochet the 1st single_crochet is made in the double_crochet of round 3 2 treble_crochet in the fl of the half_double_crochet of round 1 see 1 st photo below single_crochet x 8 slip_stitch in the bl of the 1st single_crochet and pull through c 3 single_crochet 2 treble_crochet round 5 c the double_crochet s are made in the fl of the double_crochet of round 3 straight below each double_crochet of round 3 will have 2 double_crochet worked into it at the end of this round chain 1 double_crochet 2 single_crochet 1 in each treble_crochet of round 4 double_crochet single_crochet in the 2nd single_crochet of 3 of round 4 double_crochet in the same st as the previous double_crochet x 7 2 single_crochet double_crochet in the same st as the 1st double_crochet of this round shown in the 1st photo below single_crochet in the same st as the starting chain 1 of this round was made in shown in the 2nd photo below slip_stitch in the bl of the 1st double_crochet and pull through b 3 single_crochet 2 double_crochet from here on make sure that you do not crochet your fp stitches too tightly you maintain an even gauge on the yarn that is carried along when crocheting in tapestry not too tight to prevent cupping and not too loose to prevent bumps © big splash by yvonne van zijl @bokkyshome 2023 9 round 6 b and a this round is crocheted in tapestry bold writing is crocheted in the second color don t forget to carry the second color along when you start in this round remember change color in the last pull through of the previous color as in the 1st photo below chain 1 2 fpedc 1 around each treble_crochet of round 4 single_crochet in the double_crochet of round 5 double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet in the fl of the st between the 2 double_crochet of round 5 indicated with the needle
